text.text_translated: In the last 200 years, technology and health became better. This meant that fewer children died when they were young. This caused fast population growth. These large families had even more children. These children grew up and had their own families. However, things changed in the 1960s. Contraception is the use of methods to prevent pregnancy. It became more common. Now, the global average number of babies for each woman has gone down. It has dropped from six to only two.

feedback.feedback: PASS. The text adheres to all B1 standards. Sentences are short and clear. Vocabulary is controlled. The keyword 'contraception' is correctly defined. Factual accuracy is maintained.
